description: A minimalist logic puzzle game where you uncover safe zones while avoiding hidden mines.
rationale: Minesweeper is a timeless classic that tests deductive reasoning and pattern recognition. It provides a perfect environment for AI agents to learn decision-making under uncertainty and grid-based state estimation.
details: The game consists of a 10x10 grid containing 10 randomly placed hidden mines. Each cell is initially covered. When a user reveals a cell, it either contains a mine (game over) or a number representing the count of mines in the 8 adjacent cells. If the number is 0, the surrounding cells are automatically revealed. The game is won when all non-mine cells are uncovered. The UI will use a high-contrast monochromatic design with professional gray and blue tones.
how_to_build: uv venv && uv pip install pygame
how_to_stop: kill -9 $(pgrep -f 'python main.py') or close the pygame window
how_to_play: Left click to reveal a cell. Right click to place a flag on suspected mines. The score is calculated based on the number of non-mine cells revealed. Win by revealing all 90 safe cells without hitting a mine. AI agents should use the revealed numbers as input state to calculate the probability of mines in adjacent cells.
